Title.evidence: Long-term Outcomes of Off-Pump vs On-Pump Coronary Artery Bypass Grafting: A Randomised Controlled Trial

Trial_Design.evidence: Participants were randomly assigned to off-pump or on-pump CABG.

Participants.evidence: This randomised controlled trial involved 2203 veterans from 18 VA medical centers

Intervention.evidence: Participants were randomly assigned to off-pump or on-pump CABG.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcomes were all-cause death and a composite endpoint of death or subsequent revascularization over 10 years.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was performed centrally, and outcome assessors were blinded.

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 1104 patients were assigned to off-pump and 1099 to on-pump CABG.

Number_Analysed.evidence: Analyses were conducted using an intention-to-treat approach.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The 10-year death rates were 34.2% for off-pump and 31.1% for on-pump (relative risk, 1.05; 95% CI, 0.99-1.11; P = .12).

Funding.evidence: The study was funded by the Department of Veterans Affairs.
